perturbation.original_text: Pursuant to the doctrine of sequential liability, payment from Kubient to Customer shall be made within seven (7) days from Kubient's receipt of payment, regardless of when Customer submits an invoice.
perturbation.changed_text: Pursuant to the doctrine of sequential liability, payment from Kubient to Customer shall be made within thirty (30) days from Kubient's receipt of payment, regardless of when Customer submits an invoice.
perturbation.explanation: This creates an in-text contradiction. Section 5 originally states that payment from Kubient to Customer shall be made within seven (7) days from Kubient's receipt of payment, but it has been changed to thirty (30) days. This creates ambiguity about the actual payment deadline, leading to uncertainty and potential disputes.

perturbation.original_text: The initial term of this Agreement shall be one (1) year from the Effective Date (the "Initial Term"). This Agreement will automatically renew for additional 1-year terms unless earlier terminated pursuant to this Agreement's express provisions (together with the Initial Term, such additional periods the "Term"). Neither Party may terminate this Agreement during the Initial Term except as set forth in paragraph 4(b) or any Exhibit. Either Party may terminate this Agreement for any reason following the Initial Term upon ninety (90) days written notice to the other Party.
perturbation.changed_text: The initial term of this Agreement shall be one (1) year from the Effective Date (the "Initial Term"). This Agreement will automatically renew for additional 1-year terms unless earlier terminated pursuant to this Agreement's express provisions (together with the Initial Term, such additional periods the "Term"). Either Party may terminate this Agreement during the Initial Term except as set forth in paragraph 4(b) or any Exhibit. Either Party may terminate this Agreement for any reason following the Initial Term upon thirty (30) days written notice to the other Party.
perturbation.explanation: This introduces a contradiction in the termination clause. The original text requires ninety (90) days written notice to terminate the agreement following the initial term, but this has been changed to thirty (30) days. This creates uncertainty about the amount of notice required for termination.

perturbation.original_text: Recipient will protect the Confidential Information, for one (1) year from the date of disclosure, by using at least the same degree of care as it uses to protect its own Confidential Information, but no less than a reasonable degree of care, to prevent unauthorized use, disclosure or publication.
perturbation.changed_text: Recipient will protect the Confidential Information, for five (5) years from the date of disclosure, by using at least the same degree of care as it uses to protect its own Confidential Information, but no less than a reasonable degree of care, to prevent unauthorized use, disclosure or publication.
perturbation.explanation: The confidentiality clause originally protects confidential information for one (1) year from the date of disclosure, but this has been changed to five (5) years. This creates an inconsistency about how long the Recipient needs to protect the Confidential Information.
